website_summaries.verdict: An attractive, well-made model that surpasses its competitors with its modern style and handy features.
pros: Contemporary steel frame includes handy wine glass holder
Swiveling spout makes it versatile and easy to use
cons: It's more expensive than other models on our shortlist

customer_reviews.title: Rusts quickly and easily, AVOID (see photos)
customer_reviews.text: Rusted in under 1 year of use, very disappointing I am currently in the midst of reaching out to simplehuman to see how they will respond, will update this review accordingly if I get a positive response to my request
customer_reviews.author: Asmallchild

customer_reviews.title: You're Going to Love This Dish Rack
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this dish rack for over a year and can state unequivocally this is the best dish rack in the history of man. (How's that for drama?) It is easy to set up. While it sits on the counter, there is a pan beneath the rack that drains all water into the sink; it is just wonderful. The only way it could be improved upon would be to make it more collapse-able for storage. You may pay a bit more, but you won't be disappointed in any way. There is even a rack for hanging your wine glasses to dry. The folks at simplehuman really do have their fingers on the pulse of the market.
customer_reviews.author: TobiGail

customer_reviews.title: Rusted in less than 2 years - claims to have a 5 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: The best dish rack, but don't expect it to last 5 years, mine lasted 2. Issue #1: Claims to be rust proof (see photo) but rusted a lot in under 2 years (see photo). Issue #2: Claims to have a 5-year warranty but the web page they reference in their paperwork, does not exist I still bought another one because we like is so much, but their warranty is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Drennan

customer_reviews.title: coming apart after 8 mo with little use
customer_reviews.text: RUBBER MOLDING COMING OFF ALREADY AND DOES NOT STAY ON AND IS ONLY 8 MO OLD AND HAS HAD VERY LITTLE USE. VERY DISAPPOINTED AS FELT AS THOUGH almost $80 for a dish drainer is should have held together. Please assist me Amazon !
customer_reviews.author: cami

customer_reviews.title: Love with one big caveat.
customer_reviews.text: I really love everything about this dish rack but One thing which has turned out to be a deal breaker for me. Plates will not stay standing up independently. They lean against each other. It doesn't matter which direction I place them in and I have standard plates. I have tried every possible way to put them in and they lean against each other at the top. The one thing I need in a rack is for the dishes to dry quickly which they won't do if they are touching each other. Other than that it's a great rack. I am sure this won't bother some people.
customer_reviews.author: G. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Next....
customer_reviews.text: Strongly dislike this dish rack! It was a replacement from a previous SimpleHuman. There is nothing inside rack to help stack dishes with any organization. It is like playing Jenga every time you need something. I like SH products, but I would advise you pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: thegreydog

customer_reviews.title: The concept is great, but the execution is flawed
customer_reviews.text: Based on reviews I purchased this Dish Rack. I have had it for more than 6 months. Here's the truth. Mold and mildew grow on the swivel drain. I have to take the entire dish rack apart to properly clean, and it is a struggle to unscrew the swivel drip spout from the tray. The rubber piece that goes around the edge of the drain has never fit and that collects mold and mildew as well. The concept is great, but the execution is flawed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter C.

customer_reviews.title: A Smart Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack has a functional, sturdy and beautiful design. It is compact yet spacious; well-built (solid); very easy to clean; has a tongue, which directs water right into the sink where it belongs; AND has great eye appeal. I receive compliments on this dish rack often. My only suggestion...it should be offered in various colors. Nevertheless, I would purchase it many times over again!
customer_reviews.author: AFrankComment

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best drainer yet. Owned it over a year. Descent from 5 stars to one as product did not last two years. Time spent (probably in my estimation) getting money back would be a waste of time. A replacement from Simple Human (and I do feel very simple trying this product) would be fruitless.
customer_reviews.author: Pitmixeduppup

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed!
customer_reviews.text: My parents didn't want to replace their dishrack from probably the early 2000s and I convinced them to get this and it's changed the kitchen entirely and I know that for me, it makes me more motivated to clean because it just looks so much nicer and works so much better, and all the parts seem to be easily cleanable. It really is a gorgeous dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: AndEls

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: This thing was awesome. WAS. We ordered it is January 2020, but didn’t open and use it until March. Here we are, month 5, and the drain spout is broken off and laying in the bottom of the sink. No damaging impact, or event. Just broken. Since the return window is closed, I looked at the website to see what a replacement drain tray would cost.....$20. So now the cost to own this is $100 for 5 months of use. The quality is far too low for the initial cost, and especially too high for the maintenance cost. (Which I cant believe a dish dryer even needs)
customer_reviews.author: Chelsey

customer_reviews.title: Convenience and cost can’t beat!
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how quick it got to me. Ordered just 2 days prior to arrival! Saved a bunch instead of purchasing in store. It came with plastic covers for the metal feet that helps to preserve my granite countertops. It did not come with the knife holder, so I just took the one off my existing and voila it was perfect! Overall happy to have replaced our old one. I registered for the 5-year warranty should it rust before then. Hopeful that process, if we need to walk through it, is a pleasant experience as this one has been.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't buy this until they fix the gasket problem
customer_reviews.text: Overall, this is a handsome dish rack that is versatile and well-designed. But there is one major flaw that quickly occurred in both of the racks that I've bought: the rubber gasket that seals the joint between the top and bottom sections of the rack easily gets dislodged, usually within a month or two of purchase. It repeatedly catches on dishes, pots, and pans, and is impossible to re-seat (yes, I watched their painfully slow online video). My most recent purchase in 2017 has the same problem as the rack I purchased in 2013. Reviews by others reveal the same problem. Surprising for a Simple Human product.
customer_reviews.author: Rick G

customer_reviews.title: So far it looks great.
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today, it looks great. Feels sturdy. It's huge! I usually trainers, and always kept it in our sink, but now that the kids are helping with dishes, they do better with two sinks open. Most trainers are ugly, but this one is stylish. Plus the feet make it tall enough to go over the lip of our farm sink. The drain wasn't quite long enough unless it is setting on top of the sink rim, which made it slanted back. So I put rubber feet just on the two feet that set on the counter. Besides the cost, which was crazy I know, I am happy. Hopefully it will be worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: lcm

customer_reviews.title: Please see attachment. This is what I found when ...
customer_reviews.text: Please see attachment. This is what I found when I opened the product. How you can solve this issue. This rubber works as water barrier between steel. If it does not perform its function then I would face rusting within few months
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: So far I really like this dish rack. It's really big and very nice looking. Most importantly it works well. Initially I was concerned that the glass holders wouldn't hold my acrylic cups, as the walls are rather thick but they fit perfectly. We just got a water softener installed not to long ago so I'm hoping the bottom remains as easy to clean as it has been so far. No complaints whatsoever. I'll adjust my review if things should change.
customer_reviews.author: T. Berry

customer_reviews.title: LITERALLY THE COOLEST PURCHASE from Simplehuman products!
customer_reviews.text: This product is simply AMAZING. It was a hanging drying rack for your wine glasses, side slots for your glasses/mugs and huge space for all your plates, bowls, pots and pans! My favorite feature is probably going to have to be the water drain that goes right into the sink. No more smelly soaking drying mat!! THIS DISH RACK IS THE FUTURE!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Chaneco

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but it is made cheap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in June 2016, my first review was a happy one. I thought it looked beautiful. A year later I regret spending the money on it. I spend so much time cleaning the drops all over the place because it definitely starts showing. Spare yourself the money!
customer_reviews.author: Luna E

customer_reviews.title: Love this dish drain!
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a dishwasher (well, my husband is the dishwasher!), so we usually have a lot of dishes to drain. This is the biggest dish drain I've found and it works beautifully, sitting up on its little feet to make the (new) counter tops look better. When it's empty (very rarely), it's an elegant looking kitchen accessory. I couldn't be more pleased! I especially love the wine glass holders (which we put in the back - you can do a lot of different placements with this drain), and the fact that you can change the drain around while still draining the water into the sink. A definite best buy for us.
customer_reviews.author: mjglangston

customer_reviews.title: A big flaw.
customer_reviews.text: There rubber seals that connect the sidewalls of the plastic pan to the stainless sidewalls of the unit are not flush. This allows water to get in between there are can pool up and get filthy and moldy. For $80 I expect way better than this. I expect the seals to do their job and this cannot happen if they are not flush. It was actually worse than the pictures I attached but I did all that I could to lessen the gaps manually. I will be contacting the company to see if I got one that's defective or if they all come like this. Poor quality inn my opinion for this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: 2020 model side cup racks are weak, otherwise a very useful Kitchen article.
customer_reviews.text: This 2020 model of the dish rack is excellently designed with one significant flaw. The side hanging racks for cups on inserted in the molded plastic base and because of the leverage of any mug the plastic cannot handle the weight overtime. The 2021 model apparently has addressed this design flaw and therefore may be a superior choice. You can see the difference in the mounting of that side cup rack if you inspect the 2020 and 2021 images carefully. Otherwise both represent a significantly convenient repository for wet dishes. I applaud simplehuman for making this engineering upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: SuperCoder

customer_reviews.title: Really nice with weight to it.
customer_reviews.text: Good looking unit but pricey however if it does the job it will be worth it .the trays and their swivel drain is great. the wine glass racks are all nice however is hard to use the wine rack unless you have access to the rack from both sides and the drain can still be accessed. The fact that the wine rack can be removed so that you can put it up against a wall is nice and the drain area for glasses and the fact that they can be pushed inside is also a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: Princess Honey

customer_reviews.title: Quality issues after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I like this dish rack more than any other that I've owned. However, after 2 years, the rubber gasket that sits inside the rack doesn't want to stay in place anymore. It's pretty disappointing that after only 2 years, an $80 dish rack would already be having problems that I can't fix. I've had other, cheaper dish racks that have lasted a lot longer!
customer_reviews.author: C. Vonludwig

customer_reviews.title: good choice for families who cook
customer_reviews.text: We are a family of five and have home cooked family dinners most nights = lots of pots, pans and assorted other items. As the primary dishwasher I was very dissatisfied with a recent purchase of a nice but too small dishrack so I upgraded to the simplehuman. It is very sturdy, well made and looks like a quality item on the countertop. It is large so make sure you have adequate counterspace. It may be more than you need if you are not frequently preparing family meals.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Healy

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I'm tired of trying the microfiber cloths to put my dishes on to dry. They never do. I also don't want an old fashioned rubber coated dish strainer. The Simple Human offers this little dandy. I love it. Even my husband is impressed. the design (as all Simple Human things I've ever used ) is unique. I can put on either side of ny sink. the movable drain is perfect. I now have dry dishes in a very smartly designed drainer. The one I purchased is the large one which suits my needs. It would be too big for a small counter I think.
customer_reviews.author: CAP

customer_reviews.title: features not mentioned
customer_reviews.text: I like this product. They were not clear on their own features, though. The stemware drip tray does fold up out of the way when not in use, and the tray on the other side will also slide out so that it is under the water glass clips on that side. I also had a problem registering the warrantee on their website, as this item did not seem to be an option by the choices given, yet its picture was all over the place; I accidentally registered the wrong product. So, check that better than I did. Not a knock on the drainer itself.
customer_reviews.author: Vera

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding customer service
customer_reviews.text: i am on my 3rd rack in 4 years. Why am i giving a good review? because customer service is outstanding - they do stand by their product and it is indeed covered as they promise. i love this rack - big, study, comfortable, stylish. it is not a long lasting but that does not bother me since company stand by their product and replace if needed.
customer_reviews.author: barracuda

customer_reviews.title: Dish rack
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd dish rack from simple human, like the other one we had that lasted over 10 years, this one seems so far to be just as sturdy if not even more. Has a nice hanging rack on the back for wine glasses that we use to hang all sorts of other things like, measuring spoons, bottle covers that have finger loops in um, and what ever else has a loop or a hole in it. Over all very pleased, kinda pricey, but pleased and looks good in the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: Really Like!!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I like the dish rack. I was hesitant to purchase because of the high price, but I’m glad I did. Picture attached. 12/28/2019- it been about a month, and I’m still happy. It took me several months to finally decide to buy this dish rack because of the high cost, but I do not regret my purchase. Arranging the dishes was a bit awkward, but if start by putting the dishes up against the edge; you’ll have no problems. Also, notethat the dishes do not stack all in the same direction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a well thought out and well engineered dishrack.
customer_reviews.text: This is a classy, well built dishrack. It is thoughtfully designed with several clever innovations. It is for our beach house in Hawaii where everything rusts quickly. This is built of stainless (which will eventually rust there slightly) so it should be serviceable to a long while to come. The plastic coated wire frame types are worthless after a short while, and the "formed" plastic trays are so cheapo. This is a reasonable compromise. We have many Simple Human products and this company continues to manufacture equipment is a cut above the cheap stuff. Strongly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stephan

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice dish rack. We wanted something more nice and luxurious than regular dish racks. It definitely looks nice and makes our sink to finish its look. It is pretty big so I am not sure if this would work for smaller space. I wish the cutting board holder was big thicker it is too thin to fit anything in. Product came and it had few scratches but we just decided to use it without contacting the seller. However, I do wish they had better product control before shipping out. It's spacious and easy to use but it does get lots of water stains and it is hard to clean them.
customer_reviews.author: Andy D.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS
customer_reviews.text: When I moved to a new apartment that did not have a dishwasher I knew I wanted a nicer dish rack as it would have to stay out all the time. I knew this was an investment as it is much more expensive than most dish racks, however, it is totally worth the money. I love the drain on this so that you are not just left with sitting water on a tray like most of them. Also, it looks really nice. So nice in fact that when a neighbor was over for a visit he loved it as well and ordered one that night! Definitely recommend if you need a dish rack that has to stay out!
customer_reviews.author: Lainey

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: First thing this is not a small unit if you want something small you need to get a unit that says compact. That said i bought it for its size as a father of 4 children i needed the capacity. So far the unit is very nice and sturdy. The swivel drain is awesome and helps you put it in different positions around the sink. The Drain is also extendable to the one side, also very nice if you need an extra 2 inch reach.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: I love this dish strainer. Fits perfectly on my small counter. Any water that is left over buy the dishes runs into the sink. I love how it has space to put your glasses and mugs, on the other side it has a rack for wine glasses. A spacious place for you sliver ware. Perfect for plates, bowls and everything you may need to clean. Perfect as I don’t have a dishwasher.
customer_reviews.author: Anne-Marie Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Received a damaged unit with improperly-sized pieces
customer_reviews.text: One of the plastic tips that the unit’s legs are supposed to snap into was improperly sized, thus preventing the metal leg from snapping all the way in. Additionally, the plastic part of the wine stand have what appear to be two large scratches across the surface. I’m unsure whether these are supposed to be a design of some sorts, but if so, it’s an incredibly ugly design. Overall, we were disappointed by the quality of this rack given the price.
customer_reviews.author: Hawks2thesuperbowl

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Pros: sturdy, nice looking and drains well. Room for the many odd size plastic containers we wash daily Cons: wish it held more than 8 plates/lids; wine glass rack is useless unless you use stemmed glasses on a regular basis (we don’t ); If your sink is on a diagonal you may find it hard to drain directly into the sink (we put down a small rectangular lid to catch the drainage in order to keep the drainer perpendicular to the counter.)
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Never knew I needed this
customer_reviews.text: We've been using towels laid out on the counter for drying things that didn't fit in the dishwasher. This seemed pricy but the company always makes sturdy, simple products. I'm in love with this. It drains right into the sink. I can adjust it for whatever I'm drying. I just wish I could adjust the height. It looks tall. Still, I love it. Looks great in my smallish kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Ellen Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, ingenious, well-made product...
customer_reviews.text: Most amazing dish drainer I've ever seen! My elderly parents' sink lip is elevated above the countertop area, and other drainer leaked water on counter and floor despite all they could do. This works so well, wish I would have found it for them years ago. We all love it!
customer_reviews.author: patricia bergman

customer_reviews.title: Great Dish Rack! Met all my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a high quality dish rack that was attractive and also had lower catchment for the water dripping from the cups(most dish racks simply drip to the counter top for cups). This dish rack met all my needs and expectations. I like that it has a drain spout which can be directed to the sink. The lower section for the cups can be pushed pulled out or slide under the rack. The wine cup rack is remove able. I leave min under the dish rack and occasionally will use it to dry long utensils.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the poor quality in the plastic
customer_reviews.text: Pretty disappointed that within 2 weeks of purchase the clip for glasses broke. The plastic piece broke off and now I'm missing one of the glasses racks. For $80.00 it shouldn't break so easily - and not, I'm not hanging 2L german boot glasses off the clips. I think my husband reached out to CS but we never heard back. I can't return it b/c I'm not going to keep a box expecting a simple human product to break within 2 weeks. 2 stars b/c my last simplehuman dishrack lasted for years. I'll reconsider if I'll buy the brand when it's time to replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Worth  the extra cost for me compared to standard wire drying rack.
customer_reviews.text: I have used for less than a month. I like that this is bigger than my standard drying rack was and holds much more. It has adjustable shelf to fit size of my counterspace. It looks neater than my old standard wire rack. I think it will protect my counter better and I don't need to wipe my counter dry each time I use it. Water drips directly into my sink neatly instead of collecting it tray below the dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M.

customer_reviews.title: THE GREATEST DISH RACK EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT RUST! I purchased this dish rack 5 years ago and it still looks amazing. We use it every single day and it has held up flawlessly. Zero rust. The last dish rack you will ever need to purchase. We went through about 5 different brands before stumbling upon this one. All of the previous racks rusted horribly. This one is PERFECT! I just purchased another one 5 years later, just in case they discontinue it or something. PURCHASE THIS DISH RACK!
customer_reviews.author: Sam A.

customer_reviews.title: Well designed product
customer_reviews.text: I just love things that are sturdy and well designed. I’ve had a simple human trash can for years so was intrigued by this *expensive* dish rack. Having said that, it’s perfect for a small family (3 humans + 4 pets) who are at home all the time during quarantine. There is a place for every dish you can imagine and really helps keep the sink and counters clear of the constant stream of dishes we produce. Easy to assemble, drains water directly into the sink. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: BakeSail

customer_reviews.title: One big flaw
customer_reviews.text: I'm editing this down to one star, the silverware holder is a nightmare, which as photographed, tilts and drops silverware if you wren't constantly balancing the load of forks as they go in. The number of times things have fallens, broken, etc... this thing is the worst. I have no idea how it is 4.5 stars. Your dishes would be better suited on a paper towell on the counter...
customer_reviews.author: Dom

customer_reviews.title: Best dish drain with 5 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: It costs $80 for the full sized dish rack, but there is a 5 year warranty, so I figured I would try it. Look at my pictures! I had a large sink full of dishes to wash and they all fit in this dish rack. The drainage is incredible. Look at the water flow away from the dishes. My counter top is dry! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: andy cc

customer_reviews.title: Best dish rack ever
customer_reviews.text: love this rack, hopefully it will last us as many years as our last simplehuman rack did. this is a better version. slightly smaller than the other but it makes up for it with the water draining instead of pooling & how easy it is to keep clean. we don't use the wine rack part of it, but everything else is sturdy & perfect. will always buy simplehuman the price is higher but you save in the long run because you won't need to replace for years & years (in our case the last one lasted approx. 7 years).
customer_reviews.author: ihatenicknames

customer_reviews.title: Substantial
customer_reviews.text: This is RIDICULOUSLY expensive for a dish rack. OK, with that out of the way... This is exactly what I needed! I love that the water drains right out. It has a spout and you can even direct the run off. It is large but does not take up too much room. Also it fold in the side items easily for storage. It's heavy and durable. So far no problems. Looks fancy on the counter!
customer_reviews.author: MauiMermaid

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: After several returns here and Bed Bath & Beyond we finally found a match with this item. It’s huge, high, deep, has the handy draining system that you decide where the water flows. The rack is sturdy. Plenty of space for utensils and such. We don’t need the wine rack part, so we left it off. What more can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Redmond

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised with my raised sink lip problem.  Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: What sold me was the fact that it was raised on four legs and had a drain spout as I have a ceramic kitchen sink with a raised lip of 0.5" to 0.75" around it and the drain spout would allow drainage over that lip. Previous attempts at using a Rubbermaid dish dryer involved a Rube Goldberg-esque amalgam of contraptions that was extremely fragile and kept falling apart. This was much sturdier and it was even bigger than the Rubbermaid dish dryer. The wine glass rack at the back also came in handy for drying long spatulas. I'm extremely pleased with this disk rack as it works excellently as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Voracious Reader-Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!! Love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dish rack just a day ago and I already love it. The design is so attractive, plenty of space for all your dishes, strong, shiny and sleek look. I've been looking for a stainless steel one for few yrs now. Ended up ordering this. Wish it was less pricey though, but its worth it. The cheap plastic ones, which I've been using all my life, gets dirty so fast and its annoying to deep cleaning for that and for that you might have to buy every 2yrs. Hopefully this one stays longer with rust free, lets see! So far love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Rathi Raja

customer_reviews.title: slim and strong
customer_reviews.text: so happy with this product took some getting use to wave your hand on wave your hand off sometimes my head turns it down or up wish their was a hold button for the setting, but lites dim from very bright to very dim and anywhere in between fan on low is strong high is very strong 4 speed settings after 6 weeks I love it.....
customer_reviews.author: Robert Antuno

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this purchase. It is not only attractive on my counter but also has many features that allow for functional use. The adjustable draining spout and expandable drip tray was perfect for the design of my sink allowing the excess water to drain directly into the sink by placing the spout in the most convenient place, The wine glass holder was a perfect height for allowing long stem glasses to dry. There is plenty of space for dishes to drain and the accessible knife block helps to stabilize knives while the other utensils are placed in the attached holder. I would highly recommend this product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item keep breaking in different parts of the product I have had to replace different parts on this item and now it is broke again and when I called the company they always have a please call back its regular business hours and they never answer the phone. The first one I bought last at a great time but this one within the 10 months it has broke three times and had to replace parts to it now I'm requesting to get another one and see how that work.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Wanda O Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Major design flaw - fixable. Otherwise great.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has one major design flaw which is that the canisters that are meant for holding silverware and utensils do not stay mounted to the frame when you fill them. Put a spatula in the back canister and the whole business tilts right off the frame. We solved the problem by fastening the utensil canisters to the main frame- but this seems like a pretty big oversight. Other than that, this drying rack is plenty big, easy to clean and simple. I like that the plastic is gray - probably won’t yellow over time like clear plastic would.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves It
customer_reviews.text: Probably not the best idea to just give this to your wife for Christmas but when she’s stressing out about having a new house and not knowing which dishwashing rack to pick, sometimes you just got to pull the trigger. Honestly, super clean, no issues, easy to set up. You get your money’s worth.
customer_reviews.author: Off Brand Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good design but build quality not up to snuff
customer_reviews.text: The adhesive that holds the gasket for the main body pieces is failing after six weeks. This means drips escape the main tray area and run down the side rather than into the tray below as designed. Considering I bought this premium stainer to keep drips off the counter in the first place, it's a big failing for me.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Vonnegut

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I'd see the day that I'm this excited about a dish rack but this thing looks amazing on my counter. There's cheaper dish racks out there, sure, but this thing is so worth it just with the amount they've put into the design. Its fairly easy to clean, I throw mine in my dishwasher somewhere around once a month but I imagine it would be fine though a little awkward to hand wash in a sink. Works great for drying my insulated mugs and pans and the wine glass rack, though I rarely use it, is a nice addition!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and well made but measure your space carefully
customer_reviews.text: This review is for the larger size. The wine glass holder is great, it also has a tray for cups. The silverware holder can go on either the inside or outside. The drainage system is clever and works well. I like the clean modernist look. Note well: the contraption is pretty large so measure your space to make sure it will fit. When not in use I put it out of the way on top of the fridge as it take up a lot of counter space. I have a friend with the smaller one and I think the features on the larger one are nicer. But it is rather bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M. Cameron

customer_reviews.title: small nit picky things, solid rack nonetheless
customer_reviews.text: bought it as a xmas present, after a month's use, it's still look new. can't give it 5 stars because water doesn't completely drain and pools up along the collector tray and spout (if only i can get my hands on some hydrophobic spray...). another issue is the rubber gasket that goes around the perimeter didn't fit 100%. Otherwise the wine rack is useful for other things besides wine glasses, solid construction. we'll see how it holds up with time
customer_reviews.author: Eric Liao

customer_reviews.title: NICE BUT NEEDS SOME IMPROVEMENT
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with the dish drain. I can fit ALOT of dishes, cutting bards, saucepans, glasses in it. One thing I would ask Simple Human to change about it is flatware caddy will topple up or down on either side, depending on which side is heavier with flatware. The drain spout broke off, huge bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Cesario

customer_reviews.title: Where’s the Knife Holder?
customer_reviews.text: Previously used/owned the older white version for approx ten years. Finally upgraded to this version due to the old one rusting everywhere. Humidity in Hawaii probably didn’t help. This new version would be awesome if it came with the knife holder.
customer_reviews.author: sherry

customer_reviews.title: Good Dish Drainer
customer_reviews.text: The dish drainer leans your plates kinda off back. It also scratches the inside of my coffee cups. I love the wine glass rack. I wished it had a four utensil holder slots like my Food Network dish drainer. I don't think it is worth the price tag on it. It is really convenient if you use ice tea glasses or wine glasses.
customer_reviews.author: DIANNA

customer_reviews.title: Looks 1st class!
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfect in the area next to my sink and looks perfect with my stainless steel appliances. Definitely feel bougie paying this much for a dish drying rack but with a 5 year warranty included I am confident I will get my money's worth out of this item lol!
customer_reviews.author: Valerie

customer_reviews.title: Very worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a month now and love it! I know, it's a dishrack but i've hated everyone until this one. Plus I recently installed butcher block counters so having a wet object not sitting on the counter to ruin it or growing mold under is a huge plus. I even used the wine glass part today...popped the plastic water catcher down and hung the glass. I'm very disorganized so having a large bin really helps me. I haven't found one thing I dislike about it
customer_reviews.author: snowedin

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but good
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it’s expensive. But it does look great and really looks great compared to the last rack there. I love the drain spout but I could be a inch or a half longer. I’ll update if I see any of these rust issues the other reviews talk about but I’m not ashamed any more of laying $80s for this product
customer_reviews.author: S.O

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my mom
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this dish rack for my mom who really wanted this for her kitchen. It's very elegant, and made of great quality material. However, she was expecting black trim(as shown in the picture), but after careful review it states grey plastic trim. She was a little disappointed, but she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Kynda Que'

customer_reviews.title: Stainless steel,removable parts for cleaning or storing
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh I have never owned a better dish drainer than this one . I love the style and space saving of this one . I looked forever for a dish drainer like this one , it is just what I wanted ! So happy I found it . It is sturdy and so easy to clean . It came well packaged !
customer_reviews.author: C E

customer_reviews.title: NOT SELF CLEANING!!! IF YOU WANT SELF CLEANING, GET AN AUTOMATIC DISHWASHER FOR GOODNESS SAKE
customer_reviews.text: Too many people with hard water are whining that there are hard water spots that inevitability form. I have super hard water so I'm glad this rack is easy to clean. The bottom drip catch basin is easy to remove and clean- as is the top basin. This is a wonderful rack that is big, roomy, easy to clean, and easy to move. If you have hard water, it will need an occasional wiping of the surfaces. I think it's cool how all water is channeled to one spot.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these that lasted 7 YEARS before it finally started to wear and tear enough to warrant a new purchase. It was such a wonderful dish rack that it was a no brainer to buy the same one again. The new one fell apart the same way the last one did after only a few months of use!
customer_reviews.author: M. Spear

customer_reviews.title: GET IT!
customer_reviews.text: Get this! Get this! If you are looking for a great upscale dishrack, this is it. Superhuman has always been great for our house, this is no different! Worth the money! Very useful and of course the fact that it looks nice helps our kitchen's esthetic!
customer_reviews.author: Henny Boy

customer_reviews.title: Looks very nice if you have a stainlss steel sink
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack is made well and is as attractive as a dish rack can be. Looks very nice if you have a stainlss steel sink! I would have given it five star but was dissapointed with the wine rack. Water just pools and does not drain into the main drainage system of the rack. Because of this I removed it, but the rack itself is GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Marwah

customer_reviews.title: Good looking and extremely useful
customer_reviews.text: I use this drying rack every single day and love how it looks in my kitchen. I bought the larger one and I enjoy having the attachment for drying wine glasses. This is exactly what I wanted and needed. I’m incredibly happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: mholly99

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Price
customer_reviews.text: Simplehuman products are absolutely the best. I never thought that I could be this impressed with a dish rack, but this is beautiful and well thought out. It looks like Simplehuman addressed and resolved any and all issues that other dish racks failed at. There is plenty of space, it's well made and very attractive, and it drains perfectly into the sink. It's worth every bit of what I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Mis

customer_reviews.title: Awesome dish drain
customer_reviews.text: Very large. I like the fact that you can decide which side drains back front right or left. This allows you to set up exactly for your kitchen. Simple human products are awesome I also suggest getting a garbage can! If this review was helpful please let me know by clicking the “Helpful” button below the review.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Perhaps Best Option For Large Drainer But Is Flawed.
customer_reviews.text: Several design flaws, but the best choice for a big drainer. The major design flaw is the drain spout. it accumulates mold and the only way to clean it properly is to remove the screw that holds the two parts together. See Picture. The other design flaw is the rubber gasket which seals the plastic base to the stainless rim. It comes out easily. It can be stretched to fit better though. I like the size and the good drainage. The pull out cup drip catcher and the wine rack are useful and the utensil and knife baskets re good. Will see how long this lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Tort

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what its intended to be.
customer_reviews.text: We have a double sink but my wife had one of those racks that went directly in the sink. I bough this to free up that sink. It works perfect. It is exactly what it should be. Its also easy to clean. We wash it off about once a week and we've never had a smell or anything growing on it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the best dish rack ever made!
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack is the epitome of smart design - something that has been well thought through and carefully crafted to meet the needs of the user. No more piling your wine glasses precariously on top of your pots, there is a specific place for that. There is a place for your sharp knives so they don't dull by rubbing agains the metal basket for utensils. The drain is angled in a way where it actually drains and dries every time instead of pooling water and making scum. This dish rack is seriously the best and is worth every penny. I love it more every time I look at it.
customer_reviews.author: Silveroo

customer_reviews.title: This thing is sooo ugly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is ginormous and wouldn't fit between the wall and my kitchen sink and it looks like a battleship. I couldn't pack it back up and ship it back soon enough. I like the idea of a drain funnel because I have a raised sink but I just could get past the ugly look and the huge size.
customer_reviews.author: Edward M. Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Product Has Changed
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this item when compared to previous dish rack purchases of the same item is almost rock bottom. The product has changed and not in a positive way. I won't purchase another one. Not worth the money. It looks as though the second or third generation has come to work.
customer_reviews.author: Treismom

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: You are more than likely wondering if this is truely worth the price. I’m hear to say that it undoubtedly is. Throw away your old crappy, small, and low quality dish rack. Upon recieval of this product, I was pleasantly surprised by the weight and quality of materials used. It is twice the size as our old dishrack which was a welcomed surprise as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson Elias

customer_reviews.title: Great dishrack
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old simple human dish rack this one is even better! Instead of a white bottom it has a dark gray they blend in even better. The only down side is the glasses holder on the side piece doesn't expand out like the old one. It's firmly in place so my coffee cups don't fit as nice. Very minor complaint. Also didnt come with the knife drying slot but I salvaged my old one and it fit nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good dish rack
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good dish rack. Pros: drains well, looks sleek Cons: a little too high, harder to stack dishes, no specific knife slots, the wine glass rack is not that useful
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: It functions as I wanted it to.
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this. I've bought previous ones and have never been happy with the way they drain. Mast last one had the bad habit of pooling water in the middle. This one actually drains properly. It is larger than I expected (I did not pay enough attention to the specs) but that turned out to be a good thing. I appreciate the fact that there is space underneath it which makes it easy to spot things sliding under. My favorite thing, next to the drainage, is the way that have options for drying wine glasses and other glasses/mugs/cups.
customer_reviews.author: T'challa

customer_reviews.title: Finally, THANK YOU
customer_reviews.text: Thank You! This company has cornered the market on an awesome looking and superior functioning dish drainer. Very high quality stainless steel. It has a movable drain spout on the bottom so you can use the drainer vertical or horizontal on the counter simply by rotating it. It has a knife holder to preserve your blades when drying. It has cool glass dryers on the side with a pull out tray to expand the drying load. I don't use the wine glass assembly, I like it without it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Fair warning. This is big so you need space. I wanted big so it was good for me. It is heavy and won't move easily once placed. The last dish rack was lovely, but kept falling over, rattling and could not carry the weight or my things. I don't need the wine glass rack so I will think of something to use it for. Good, heavy and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Silloway

customer_reviews.title: This dish rack completes me
customer_reviews.text: This dish rack is gigantic and looks fantastic and I love it. No more struggling to perch a thousand hand washed objects on a teetering stack. Holds all the washing up, even for my husband's most ambitious culinary adventures. The wineglass rack has been especially useful. Not just for wineglasses, but for holding things like my rolling pin and the plunger for our french press. I love this dish rack.
customer_reviews.author: bad_example

customer_reviews.title: Wow !!! Exceeds all expectations !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love at first sight...does not disappoint...a lot of pictures from past customer purchases are obsolete...this product has been updated and is a winner... simple human products are always substantial...and hard working...this handsome dish drainer is no exception... I just love it !!!
customer_reviews.author: reva weems

customer_reviews.title: Great product and totally worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This product is fantastic and looks stunning. We bought it as a gift for my mom for mother's day and while she didn't seem super pleased at first.. this item has so far exceeded expectations that she's ecstatic about it now. She keeps it in a corner behind her kitchen sink and we use it constantly. It looks pretty and like a feature of the kitchen instead of an eye sore and it worked fantastically. The drain is an awesome idea and tends to sit just on the edge of the sink so the excess liquid drains into the sink without being in the way.
customer_reviews.author: Haylee And Karl

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy dish washing families
customer_reviews.text: Very $$$ but so far it has been worth my money. My family does lots of dishes and this is the one dish rack that has been able to withstand our abuse. I highly recommend if you do a lot of dishes. Otherwise, I say just get a cheap dish rack :p
customer_reviews.author: tiffanymyang

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT designed to sit on the left side of your sink.
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous version for MANY years and was upgrading to this. The old model was FAR more functional... you could move the water spout to either side, much better rack with more ways to hold dishes in the main bay, and the old one INCLUDED the knife holder/wood block. The wine dryer rack on this nice, but not nice enough. I returned this item. Bummer:(
customer_reviews.author: Susan and Ari

customer_reviews.title: Would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: You pay premium for Simple Human because the company thinks of the small things that make a difference. Secure placement, dish tilt within the rack and even the angle to allow optimal drainage are a few things that separate this rack from lesser competitors.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: Wow the room in this dish rack is amazing. I absolutely love it. I was tired of all the other dish racks getting moldy and rusty. I read the other reviews and decided to try it for myself. I believe that it is well worth the price. I have had no problems with it and I can get more dishes in this one than any other I have used. The knife block is an absolute gem. No water gets on my counter top and I love how it drains into the sink.
customer_reviews.author: P W

customer_reviews.title: This is pretty nice, plenty of room and the knife holder ...
customer_reviews.text: We wanted something that was large capacity and wouldn't rust. This is pretty nice, plenty of room and the knife holder works well. Drains into sink and can be turned to your liking. We don't use the wine rack for wine glasses but we do use it for protein shake cups and the wire mixing balls that go in them, works great for these. We are a family of 4 and this works well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Paynar

customer_reviews.title: Only the best from Simple Human!
customer_reviews.text: Best dish rack ever. Easy to clean. Looks great. I’ve had this for over a year and still LOVE IT. Plenty of room, very convenient. It’s super easy to clean. Drains well. I added the plastic foot risers only on the back and not front legs for better drainage. Highly recommend this and you don’t need a separate unsanitary drip tray.
customer_reviews.author: Kareema

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy,  classy, sleek.
customer_reviews.text: Just got this dishrack and I'm super impressed. My husband is a bit of a product snob and even he is impressed with how well made it is. No more bendy plastic racks for this girl. I'm not even upset that I spent $80 on it.
customer_reviews.author: GbmOgun

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Simplehuman full size; I Love it! Never thought I would pay $80 for a dish rack but glad I did! However, I had to make some adjustment. I don’t have much counter space 19.5”; by adding a little surface space, 2.5”on the long side to fit. Hey, A minor issue, compared to functionality. Works good and as described. Look nice and my counter top is Not wet all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Bserena

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: When it comes to kitchen appliances, I only go to simplehuman. I believe I have had the dish rack for two years now and haven't seen any rust whatsoever. It is very durable! I bought the same dish rack for a friend of mine since I saw hers wasn't the greatest and she completely fell in love it. The customer service is also very great!
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dishrack!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a dishrack that would hold several large, heavy pans to dry at a time. This dishrack looks great, and holds everything I throw at it. I use the wine cup rack to hang my dish towels on, since we use stemless wine glasses. I haven't had any problems putting glasses on the little holders on the side, though I use these more often to hang my dish rag on so it can drip onto the tray instead of the counter. Just what I was looking for! And since it has a lifetime guarantee, I think the price was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie M

customer_reviews.title: Looks attractive AND functions well
customer_reviews.text: Okay, it's not exactly kitchen artwork, but this is pretty nice looking for a kitchen dish drainer. More to the point, it does what it's meant to do, very well. We've had this for several months and don't have any problems with mold. It is leagues better than my husband's previous method of stacking dishes on a towel until he had reached precarious height and balance; when I want, say, a knife, I don't have to worry about getting smacked with the lid to the dutch oven! The knife block is an added bonus; we use it more than I thought. **Excellent capacity; good draining; highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Kambria McLean

customer_reviews.title: Best Wash Rack!
customer_reviews.text: The storage capacity is amazing! The water dripping back into the sink is something new to me, but why I had not known about it is crazy! Makes a chore that much easier. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Sherwin

product_meta.title: simplehuman Kitchen Steel Frame Dish Rack With Swivel Spout, Fingerprint-Proof Stainless Steel Frame, Grey Plastic
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Full SizeThe simplehuman steel frame dishrack has a solid stainless steel frame that matches the aesthetic of modern upscale kitchen appliances. It has a swivel spout that pivots so you can drain water directly into the sink and an anti-residue coating that prevents residue buildup and water spots. The wine glass holder hangs up to 4 wine glasses — even those extra-large Bordeaux glasses. A fingerprint-proof coating helps protect against smudges, and a natural bamboo knife block is gentle on sharp blades.

BRAND STORY
We design tools that help people become more efficient at home.

Day to day life has room for improvement. That's the basic thinking behind simplehuman. Many activities in our daily routine are so basic that we take them for granted. Washing our hands, cleaning up after a meal, grooming and prepping our appearance. Through innovation and new technologies, we find ways to streamline these simple tasks. We call our products tools for efficient living.
feature_bullets: 5-YEAR WARRANTY - We use the best materials and solid engineering so our products will last in tough environments like your home — for years.
ANTI-RESIDUE HYDROPHILIC COATING - Causes water to spread so that the plastic tray dries more quickly and prevents residue buildup.
EXTENDABLE DRIP TRAY - Pulls out below the cup holders to catch drips.
RUST-PROOF - Durable, stainless steel materials are corrosion-resistant and won't rust or discolor.
FINGERPRINT-PROOF FINISH - Resists smudges to keep stainless steel shiny.
INNOVATIVE DRAINAGE SYSTEM - An integrated drip tray with a swivel spout pivots to keep water flowing directly into the sink, not onto the countertop.
INTEGRATED WINE GLASS RACK - Safely hangs up to 4 extra-large Bordeaux wine glasses so they dry quickly and efficiently.
UTENSIL HOLDER - Separate compartments keep utensils neat and organized.
19.8"W x 17.7"D x 12.2"H - 13.3" with optional feet attached

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,247 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
